column4: If my X config is hosed and It's a fresh install it would faster/easier to just reinstall rather than try to fix my xconf. I'm a Linux noob and can't vi my way out of a sack.
I was going to try to fire up Lynx to research the problem but U doesn't have Lynx installed by default?? I'm up on a SLAX live CD right now.
use nano or gedit they are easer to use than vi
you can run gedit from terminal yes
